page.title: 09Children's Games
page.content: **************** School playtimes are welcomed by every pupil. Most schools have 1-2 playtimes and a dinner time. Adults wonder how children entertain themselves, so here are some games children play: Most boys play football on the yard. Coats get thrown down and play begins. This is nothing like the real game of football, anyone plays on any side! Most girls play "skippy" with a skipping rope, a chant normally goes with the "skippy". Other than skipping girls play tiggy. This game includes running around, and if the person that is 'on' touches you then you are 'on',ie. you begin to chase the rest. At home boys either play football or ride around on their bikes. Girls and boys both play made up games and may go to the Youth or Recreation Centre, or may play in the street.
